page.title: 10DERBY DAY - THE SCENE
page.content:
... "We asked a few policemen where they had come from;they came from Buckingham Palace,Fulham,Banstead and Hounslow. We asked them some questions. They told us that there were 800 policemen and women,half-a-million people,40,000 cars and coaches,26 ambulances,1 fire engine,24 helicopters,10 police dogs, 150 traffic wardens,20-30 police cars and 60 police bikes. People were arriving five hours before the race."
... "I stood by the new fence. Trash on the ground everywhere. Traffic gives off the smell of fumes and the engines roar loudly. Underneath me are piles of wet,squelchy mud and bits of horse manure. I can see T.V. cameras getting ready to film the race from high scaffolding. First-aid tents dotted around,and mounted police."
